description: Mac Integration Basics is an excellent starting point for people working with Macintosh systems in a networked environment. The certification covers topics like integrating Mac and Windows PCs as well as connecting to numerous network services. Viewers who pass the Mac Integration Basics exam will be awarded the Apple Certified Associate certification.

name: Mac Integration Basics 10.12
subtitle: Sierra 10.12

episodes.description: Mac Integration Basics is an excellent starting point for people working with Macintosh systems in a networked environment. The certification covers topics like integrating Mac and Windows PCs as well as connecting to numerous network services. Viewers who pass the Mac Integration Basics exam will be awarded the Apple Certified Associate certification.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike look at working with directory services. They explain what a directory service is and the benefits of using a directory service. They demonstrate joining a MacBook to an Active Directory domain as well as an Apple OpenDirectory.
episodes.title: Directory Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike discuss connecting to a network file server using various protocols. They demonstrate how to connect by browsing the network, as well as manually entering the information. They also demonstrate how to enable file sharing and share a folder using macOS.
episodes.title: File Sharing

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike look at how to connect to various collaboration software. They demonstrate connecting to mail servers like Exchange and Office365, as well as non-Windows platforms using IMAP and POP3. They also show how to connect to calendar services and contact services.
episodes.title: Collaboration Software

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike discuss security features in MacOS. They talk about sandboxing and system integrity protection. They also describe library randomization and execute disable.
episodes.title: Security Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike continue their look at security features in MacOS. They look at how the Password Assistant can be used to help generate strong passwords. They also demonstrate multi-factor authentication.
episodes.title: Security Features Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike continue their look at security features in MacOS. They demonstrate how to set a firmware password. They also demonstrate how to lock a Mac screen, set a screen timeout, using fast user switching, and disabling automatic logon.
episodes.title: Security Features Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don they finish their conversation on security features by looking at FileVault full-disk encryption which is a data-at-rest protection. Then they explore VPNs as data-in-motion protection. Finally they show you security options for protecting from malicious applications using Gatekeeper and attacks from the network using the Firewall.
episodes.title: Security Features Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore printing with a Mac running Sierra. They take you through all the basics like connecting to a USB printer, a network printer, and wireless printers. Then they look at printer sharing, setting up an IP printer, and specifying printer features.
episodes.title: Printing

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take a look at setting up and working with Instant Messaging in Mac OS 10.12. They begin by exploring use case scenarios and then start walking you through setup.
episodes.title: Instant Messaging

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don walk you through migrating from a Windows PC to a Mac using the Windows Migration Assistant. They explain the procedure for prepping both computers for the migration and then go into the detail of each step to ensure a successful migration.
episodes.title: Migrating from Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don show you how to protect your data using Time Machine. They start by describing Time Machine's capabilities as a backup solution and then familiarizing you with the working parts and options.
episodes.title: Time Machine

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take a look at what options are available when you need to run a Windows application on your Mac. They explore possible solutions like Mac ported software and open source alternatives or using virtualization software like VMware's Fusion, to run a Windows virtual machine that will facilitate running Windows native apps.
episodes.title: Running Windows Applications

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore another option for working with Windows native applications, and that option is Boot Camp. Here they will explain when and why Boot Camp may be the correct solution for using Windows native apps and even begin demonstrating how to deploy a Boot Camp system.
episodes.title: Boot Camp

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don finish their installation of Windows on a Mac using Boot Camp. Here they take you through the final steps of booting the Mac correctly, selecting the Boot Camp drive, and installing Windows. They also explain any possible hiccups along the way.
episodes.title: Boot Camp Part 2
